content: Why is the type of the itemControl extension CodeableConcept rather than simply Coding?
We could put in a usage note to that effect. (If you wanted to write up a CR :smile: )

I might if I understood it. How would you specify which Coding in the CodeableConcept was for which language? BTW, I also see http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/translation, which is an extension that could be put on the display field of a Coding.
Not language translation, code translation. Maybe you have codes that differentiate between styles of radio buttons, so you want to send a local code in addition to the HL7 code.
Well, that is just barely plausible, but okay. :-) J#31347.
When I've included those values in our migrations, I've used our own extensions rather than coding in here.
It's often not that simple. So I just have simple extensions with the raw values from the source.

And it's not a coding, just a numeric value. And keep it there for tracing backwards if needed later.
(sometimes strip them when going to IG or prod)
